subject: Your Hit Parade
event:
Here's a catchy tune that will leave you humming.

http://scifisongs.blogspot.com/2009/08/sci-fi-song-20-george-rr-martin-is-not.html

(And no, I'm not.  Though Parris and my editor both claim I'm their bitch).

comments.article: Too funny! Maybe even three :-)

Bravo. Just picked up the two volumes of Dreamsongs, by the way. I've read all the stories before, but it's been a while and I like to reread things.

I've also taken to reading A Game of Thrones in Japanese. It's slow going. I pause to look up stuff several times per page. But it's a way to pass the time while I wait for the next book.
Ha!  That is an awesome song.  And yup, now it's stuck in my head.

Been reading Neil Gaiman's blog have you?

BWHAAHAAHAA!!

comments.upictitle: Thoughts of a nerdy feminist: Killstark
comments.article: I think dozens of us linked him to that blog post.

comments.upictitle: Jax: ff7 yuffie bw color materia

comments.article: Funny, true, and catchy to boot!  I really don't mind waiting for Dance.  Gives me time to re-read the other books!  And each read seems to reveal more that I missed the last time.
comments.subject: Amen.

comments.article: I love it when the strange conglomeration of the sci fi fandom comes together like this.  Well sung.

I suppose, we all agree that you're nobody's bitch, Mr. Martin.

Thanks for the link, the song is pretty marvelous.
I've had this song stuck in my head all day LOL.

Exactly; you're not a B****, you're a Dealer that leaves a trail of whimpering junkies in your wake waiting for their next sweet, sweet fix... :)

BTW, it's a long shot but I don't suppose there'll be any HBO Series-related happenings at PAX this year in Seattle or next Winter's Emerald City ComiCon?

I'm sorry you're still getting bombarded by acrimonious emails.  I have said it before, but I will say it again:  even if you never wrote another word, I'd still love & be grateful for what you've already put out there.  Enjoy your life, do what you want!

Bwahaha - that's hilarious! I'm so getting this for my iPod and will be listening to it on repeat for a while.

It's amazing what lengths people will go to if it means getting a laugh out of it, huh?
Nice. :)
Hahaha excellent! And very true words ^_^
That is such an awesome song ^^ I did read Gaiman's response to that crude letter back in the day. I'll polish my halo here and say, some people eh?
It's got a good beat, but can you dance to it?
Yeah, it should be a little more head-bangingly angsty ;)  But I still like it!

that made me think of something: how cool would it be (for the readers) if every one of us actually had our personal writer who would write novels tailored to our very own special needs? hehe

Even if The Dance comes out in time for my kids to read it (I'm 20), I'll wait for it, with the same excitement and admiration. *wisenod*
That's you singing it?!  I would never have pegged you as a tenor!  You have a good voice, sir!
That put a smile on my face before work.
comments.subject: thanks

comments.article: I spend enough money on a regular basis at barnes and noble that i'm keepingthem out of government bail out.. but I'd rather be buying dance of dragons than c.s freidman's feast of flesh
If you were, I'd have you locked up and telling me stories about Arya all day. :)
Nuf said!
comments.subject: Bad song, great sentiment

comments.article: Should we get Parris a t-shirt like kylecassidy, only cross out the 'not' with sharpie?
I vote yes!
It is a catchy tune, i am downloading it
I did enjoy the pin Parris was wearing at Worldcon.
